caption=Odo Proudfoot from [[The Lord of the Rings (1978 film)
'Proudfeet!' shouted an elderly hobbit from the back of the pavilion. His name, of course, was Proudfoot, and well merited; his feet were large, exceptionally furry, and both were on the table.

column4: Baggins}}</ref>) was a Hobbit of the Shire.

column1: Odo was the son of [[Bodo Proudfoot
column4: Baggins}}</ref> and gave rise to a line of [[Proudfoot Family
column5: Proudfoots]] (or, as Odo himself preferred, "Proudfeet").<ref name="Party"/>

column1: Odo was among the guests at the famous [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]] at which Bilbo Baggins disappeared.<ref name="Party"/> At that time, he was an elderly hobbit indeed, being ninety-seven years old. He only lived for a few more years after the Party,<ref name="Baggins"/> but from him had come at least two generations of descendants, including his mischievous grandson [[Sancho Proudfoot
column2: Sancho]], who attempted to excavate for treasure in [[Bag End]].<ref name="Party">{{FR

column1: The name ''Odo'' was meaningless in contemporary [[Hobbitish]] [[Westron]]. It represented an original name ''Oda''.<ref>{{App
:Odo angrily wiggles his toes as he corrects Bilbo.
'''1981: [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)

column1: '''2001: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring]]'':'''
:The character [[Everard Proudfoot]], played by [[Noel Appleby]], filled Odo's role.
